title: Net External Force Formula
text: $$F_{net}$$ $$=$$ ma, where $$F_{net}$$ is the net external force, $$m$$ is mass, and a is the acceleration of an object (due to gravity).

title: What to Calculate
text: If air resistance is negligible, the net force on a falling object is the gravitational force, commonly called its weight w. Weight can be denoted as a vector w because it has a direction; down is, by definition, the direction of gravity, and hence weight is a downward force. To find the net external force, solve for $$F_{net}$$ in $$F_{net}$$ $$=$$ ma.

title: Substituting Into the Equation
text: Plug the mass and acceleration values into $$F_{net}$$ $$=$$ ma.

title: Mass
text: What is $$m$$, the mass of the sprinter in kg?

title: Acceleration
text: What is a, the acceleration $$\frac{m}{s^2}$$ of the sprinter?

title: Plugged-In Equation
text: The plugged-in equation is $$F_{net}$$ $$=$$ $$(63)(4.2)$$. What is $$F_{net}$$, the net external force (in N)? Round to the nearest whole number.
